Package lib.graphs

Class Network<T>

java.lang.Object
lib.graphs.Graph<T>
lib.graphs.Network<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements stored in the network
All Implemented Interfaces:
GraphADT<T>, NetworkADT<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CustomNetwork
public class Network<T>
extends Graph<T>
implements NetworkADT<T>
Represents a weighted network (or graph) where vertices are connected by edges assigned with weights. The Network class extends a graph data structure with additional features to handle edge weights and supports algorithms like finding the shortest paths.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Network()
    Constructs a new, empty Network.

  • Constructor Details

    • Network

      public Network()
      Constructs a new, empty Network. Initializes the network with a default capacity and sets up the internal data structures, including the adjacency matrix for edge weights and a vertex array for storing graph vertices. Initially, the number of vertices in the network is set to zero.

  • Method Details

    • getWeightMatrix

      public double[][] getWeightMatrix()
      Retrieves the weight matrix of the network. The weight matrix is a 2-dimensional array where each element represents the weight assigned to the edge between two vertices in the network. A weight of positive infinity indicates no direct connection between the vertices.
      Returns:
      a 2-dimensional array of doubles representing the weight matrix of the network

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge​(T vertex1, T vertex2, double weight)
      Adds an edge to the network by specifying two vertices and the weight of the edge between them. The edge is bidirectional, meaning the weight is stored in both directions in the weight matrix. If either vertex is invalid (not in the network), the edge will not be added.
      Specified by:
      addEdge in interface NetworkADT<T>
      Parameters:
      vertex1 - the first vertex of the edge
      vertex2 - the second vertex of the edge
      weight - the weight of the edge to be added between vertex1 and vertex2

    • removeEdge

      public void removeEdge​(T vertex1, T vertex2) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Removes the edge between two specified vertices in the network. If the edge exists, the corresponding entries in the weight matrix are reset to Double.MAX_VALUE, indicating no direct connection between the vertices.
      Specified by:
      removeEdge in interface GraphADT<T>
      Overrides:
      removeEdge in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      vertex1 - the first vertex of the edge to be removed
      vertex2 - the second vertex of the edge to be removed
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if either vertex1 or vertex2 is not found in the network

    • addVertex

      public void addVertex​(T vertex)
      Adds a new vertex to the network. Expands the network's storage capacity if the current capacity is full. Initializes the corresponding entries in the weight matrix to positive infinity, indicating no edges between the new vertex and existing vertices initially.
      Specified by:
      addVertex in interface GraphADT<T>
      Overrides:
      addVertex in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex to be added to the network
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vertex is null

    • removeVertex

      public void removeVertex​(T vertex) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Removes a specified vertex from the network, including all its associated edges. Updates the weight matrix to reflect the removal by shifting rows and columns and marking the relevant entries as disconnected with a default value.
      Specified by:
      removeVertex in interface GraphADT<T>
      Overrides:
      removeVertex in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex to be removed from the network
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if the specified vertex is not found in the network

    • iteratorShortestPath

      public java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorShortestPath​(T startVertex, T targetVertex) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Provides an iterator that traverses the shortest path between two specified vertices in the network. The shortest path is determined based on the edge weights in the network.
      Specified by:
      iteratorShortestPath in interface GraphADT<T>
      Overrides:
      iteratorShortestPath in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the vertex from which the traversal begins
      targetVertex - the vertex at which the traversal ends
      Returns:
      an iterator over the vertices in the shortest path from startVertex to targetVertex
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if either the startVertex or targetVertex is not found in the network

    • iteratorDFS

      public java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorDFS​(T startVertex) throws EmptyCollectionException
      Provides a depth-first traversal iterator starting from the specified vertex in the network. The traversal visits vertices following the depth-first search algorithm based on the adjacency information in the network's weight matrix.
      Specified by:
      iteratorDFS in interface GraphADT<T>
      Overrides:
      iteratorDFS in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the starting vertex for the depth-first traversal
      Returns:
      an iterator over the vertices visited during the depth-first traversal
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the collection of vertices is empty

    • iteratorDFS

      public java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorDFS​(int startIndex) throws EmptyCollectionException
      Provides a depth-first traversal iterator starting from the specified vertex index in the network. The traversal visits vertices following the depth-first search algorithm based on the adjacency information in the network's weight matrix.
      Overrides:
      iteratorDFS in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      startIndex - the index of the starting vertex for the depth-first traversal
      Returns:
      an iterator over the vertices visited during the depth-first traversal
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the collection of vertices in the network is empty

    • iteratorBFS

      public java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorBFS​(T startVertex) throws EmptyCollectionException
      Provides a breadth-first traversal iterator starting from the specified vertex in the network. The traversal visits vertices in a breadth-first manner based on the adjacency information in the network's weight matrix.
      Specified by:
      iteratorBFS in interface GraphADT<T>
      Overrides:
      iteratorBFS in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the starting vertex for the breadth-first traversal
      Returns:
      an iterator over the vertices visited during the breadth-first traversal
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the collection of vertices in the network is empty

    • iteratorBFS

      public java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorBFS​(int startIndex) throws EmptyCollectionException
      Provides a breadth-first traversal iterator starting from the specified vertex index in the network. The traversal visits vertices in a breadth-first manner based on the adjacency information in the network's weight matrix. The result is returned as an iterator over the visited vertices.
      Overrides:
      iteratorBFS in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      startIndex - the index of the starting vertex for the breadth-first traversal
      Returns:
      an iterator over the vertices visited during the breadth-first traversal
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the network is empty or contains no vertices

    • shortestPathWeight

      public double shortestPathWeight​(T startVertex, T targetVertex) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Calculates the total weight of the shortest path between two vertices in the network. The shortest path is determined based on edge weights stored in the network's weight matrix.
      Specified by:
      shortestPathWeight in interface NetworkADT<T>
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the starting vertex of the path
      targetVertex - the target vertex of the path
      Returns:
      the total weight of the shortest path between the startVertex and targetVertex, or -1 if no path exists
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if either the startVertex or targetVertex is not found in the network

    • mstNetwork

      public Network mstNetwork() throws EmptyCollectionException
      Returns a minimum spanning tree of the network.
      Returns:
      a minimum spanning tree of the network
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException
